snippet: Rural life on sprawling reservations has complicated efforts to track down tens of thousands of Indians who are eligible for federal payments.
abstract: Federal government is paying $3.4 billion settlement to about half a million Indians across the West over royalties for land that was held in trust and never reimbursed in full; 30,000 Indians who are owed about $32 million cannot be located, mainly due to rural life on sprawling reservations.
lead_paragraph: Rural life on sprawling reservations has complicated efforts to track down tens of thousands of Indians who are eligible for federal payments.

headline.main: Government Owes 30,000 Indians Royalties for Land but Can’t Find Them
headline.print_headline: Government Owes 30,000 Indians Royalties for Land but Can’t Find Them
